record.alternateTitle1: W. K. Kellogg Foundation Center for Continuing Education
record.description: Pre-cast concrete columns and canopy sections of the University of Chicago's Center for Continuing Education were furnished by Martin Marietta Corporation's concrete organization. The seventy-two columns encircling the building are thirty-six feet high and have a simulated limestone appearance. The attractive light and shadow effect is achieved through 146 slots running through all four sides of the sixteen-foot wide canopy.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Photographer's stamp. Stamp: Consulting Architect received w/date.
